intro: Lepimenes, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species that are native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in the arid and semi-arid areas. The plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their rough, fissured bark and opposite, simple leaves. They produce small, clustered fruit that is edible and often used in local cuisines. Lepimenes species are also valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
